title: Police investigating after piece of a pig turns up in Newton park
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Newton police are investigating a pig flank found off a trail in Auburndale Park, accompanied by a red flag and note.
Hunting on conservation land and in Newton parks is banned under Massachusetts General Law, authorities remind the public.
Newton Animal Control and Massachusetts Environmental Police are involved in the investigation of the incident.

title: Jaylen Brown, Payton Pritchard dominate in blowout win over Lakers: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored 32 points despite shooting 10-for-28, leading the Celtics to a 111-89 win over the Lakers.
Payton Pritchard delivered a standout performance with 30 points off the bench, continuing his strong scoring streak.
LeBron James praised Jaylen Brown's MVP potential after the Celtics' dominant victory over the Lakers in Los Angeles.

title: These Mass. schools are closed on Monday, Feb. 23
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Dozens of Massachusetts school districts closed on February 23 due to a major snowstorm affecting the region.
School districts including Abington, Boston, Cambridge, and Worcester have announced closures as the snowstorm approaches.
The public is encouraged to report unlisted school closures by emailing schoolstatus@boston.com.

title: Fall River police searching for man accused of shooting, killing dog
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Kyron Simmons, 36, is wanted for allegedly shooting a dog in the Sunset Hill Housing Development in Fall River.
Simmons faces multiple charges including home invasion and discharging a firearm within 500 feet of a building.
Police identified Simmons as the suspect through security footage and conducted a search at Father Defario Village Housing.

title: Greater Boston town issues guidance after bobcat sighting
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Dedham Animal Control issued guidance on wildlife safety after a bobcat was seen near Deerpath Road and Route 109.
Bobcats are naturally elusive but active during mating season; they're sometimes seen due to available food and shelter.
Residents advised on practices like sealing entry points and supervising pets to avoid wildlife confrontations.

title: Alex Cora gives an early preview of Red Sox 2026 lineup
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Cora previewed the Red Sox 2026 lineup with Roman Anthony and Trevor Story expected as the top two hitters.
Cora confirmed Roman Anthony as leadoff hitter, benefiting from his .336 average and 1.003 OPS in late 2025 games.
Marcelo Mayer is unlikely to make the Opening-Day roster despite recent infield practice, due to competition and past injuries.

title: Live updates: What to know about the nor’easter hitting Massachusetts
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Nor'easter to bring up to 2 feet of snow and high winds to Massachusetts, impacting trees and power lines.
Boston shelters open 24 hours for homeless amid record-breaking blizzard; warming centers available in nearby towns.
MBTA trains and buses to run on reduced storm schedules Monday; DoorDash and Grubhub suspend deliveries in Boston.

title: Bruins react to McAvoy, Swayman’s gold-medal win over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman won gold with Team USA, their first Olympic win in 46 years.
McAvoy played a crucial defensive role, notably preventing a goal in the third period of the 2-1 victory.
Bruins' teammates and staff expressed pride in McAvoy and Swayman's Olympic achievement, anticipating a boost in their return to NHL play.

title: 2026 NFL Mock Draft roundup: 7 names for Patriots fans to know entering combine week
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots hold the No. 31 pick in the 2026 NFL Draft, targeting offensive linemen or edge rushers.
Draft analysts highlight prospects Zion Young, Max Iheanachor, and Kenyon Sadiq as potential picks for New England.
NFL Scouting Combine in Indianapolis will help distinguish top prospects ahead of the NFL Draft and free agency.

title: Team USA writes a new chapter and other takeaways from gold-medal triumph over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Team USA men's hockey wins Olympic gold for the first time since 1980, defeating Canada 2-1 in Milan.
Jack Hughes scores the overtime goal securing victory; Connor Hellebuyck excels, stopping 41 shots for Team USA.
Millis native Matt Boldy opens the scoring for Team USA, contributing to the historic win over Canada.
